sentences.english: The promptings of the Holy Spirit will warn you that God is not pleased with the direction your thoughts and feelings are taking you.
sentences.chinese: 聖靈會警示你神不喜悅你念頭和想法的方向。

sentences.english: This accident will serve as a reminder of guard against fire to future generations.
sentences.chinese: 這次事故成爲後來人提防火災的警示。

sentences.english: Drug manufacturers should bear the no-fault liability for drugs' warning defects.
sentences.chinese: 藥品生產商對藥品的警示缺陷應承擔無過錯責任。

sentences.english: The Bronze Ever-ringing Bell functions as a constant reminder of the tragically heroic period in history.
sentences.chinese: 這口銅製的長鳴鐘警示我們要記住這段悲壯的歷史。

sentences.english: Place the billboard of "Work Processing" on the working area.
sentences.chinese: 將“工作進行中”的警示牌放置在工作區域。

sentences.english: The warning glow of small blue dots can be seen under a fluorescent microscope.
sentences.chinese: 這種警示性熒光是在熒光顯微鏡下可見的小藍點。

sentences.english: Still, this book gives reasonable warnings about how technology could dehumanize us.
sentences.chinese: 但是這本書仍然可以警示我們技術對人的異化作用。

sentences.english: The upward-sloping trend is a telltale sign of a memory leak.
sentences.chinese: 上升趨勢是存在內存泄漏的警示信號。

sentences.english: And then there was the issue of sex.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個警示性的故事。

sentences.english: The warning sign was put there for the benefit of the public.
sentences.chinese: 警示牌放在那裏是爲了公衆的利益。

sentences.english: Hearing things is a warning sign.
sentences.chinese: 幻聽到聲音是個警示的預兆。

sentences.english: Warning lights lit up across his dashboard.
sentences.chinese: 儀表板上的警示燈亮了起來。

sentences.english: All the whispers, the warnings so clear.
sentences.chinese: 儘管所有這些低聲細語和警示是如此的清晰。

sentences.english: Objective To standardize the warning languages and the patterns in admonitory plates.
sentences.chinese: 目的使警示標識牌的圖案及警示語句達到規範化。

sentences.english: Objective To standardize the warning languages and the patterns in admonitory plates.
sentences.chinese: 目的使警示標識牌的圖案及警示語句達到規範化。

sentences.english: This is the warning to all party given by the two generation leading core.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們黨的兩代領導核心向全黨發出的警示。

definition: to remind/to call attention to/to warn of
variant of 警戒[jing3 jie4]/to warn
to point out/to remind (sb of sth)/to suggest/suggestion/tip/reminder/notice
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
lit. warning to the following cart (idiom); don't follow the track of an overturned cart/fig. draw lesson from the failure of one's predecessor/learn from past mistake/once bitten twice shy
to be on guard/wariness/to guard against/preventive
to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
